text: Bergen-Belsen concentration camp was a Nazi concentration camp during World War II. An estimated 50,000 prisoners died there, as well as 20,000 Soviet prisoners of war (POWs). Up to 35,000 of them died of typhus just before and after the camp was freed."Bergen-Belsen", United States Holocaust Memorial Museum. ==Liberation== The camp was liberated on 15 April 1945 by British soldiers."The 11th Armoured Division (Great Britain)", United States Holocaust Memorial Museum. Inside the camp, the British soldiers found 60,000 living people, and 13,000 dead bodies lying on the ground, unburied. The scenes were horrific.
